CatDescriptText: Sylvia Smith, student, Ambridge and Stanley Kletch, stationary engineer, Castle Shannon, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 1, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think that the military strength for defense of the United States is adequate enough like Presidential candidate Richard Nixon declares it is, or do you believe that it is not strong enough, and needs strengthening, like Presidential candidate John Kennedy says it is?"  Mrs. Smith's answer reads: "I say that Kennedy is right..."  Mr. Kletch's answer reads: "I think it's adequate."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sylvia Smith wearing trench coat, holding paper bag, standing in front of Sylvia and Jean's Beauty Shoppe, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Stanley Kletch wearing diamond patterned button down shirt, standing with arms folded on Smithfield Street, Downtown
